values:
okay, guys, send me pictures of home while i'm at college!  it's not a choice.  just do it.
Sarah Stites
St. John's College
P.O. Box 2800
Annapolis, MD
21404

okay, so i just read all my posts on here.  good lord.  
for any of you that don't -know- me, per se, i would just like to announce that i am not -actually- this pathetic.  eljay, if you will, seems to bring out the worst in me.  even worse than xanga, because i know the only person that reads it is adam, and i tell him all this crapola anyway.
LET IT BE KNOWN:
i am a happy, thinking individual.  this thing is not at all indicative of me, of what i'm like.
i know, i know, i've sworn off livejournal, but i really have to set the record straight here, so i'll outline my day today.

i awoke early, but only out of fear of being caught in my pajamas by the cleaners.  that always happens, and it's so embarrassing!
i called a multitude of people to find a new voice teacher in MaryLand.  moderate success.  thanks a ton, adam, for finding that woman's number for me.
i then went to buy a skirt for the upcoming funeral, as i have nothing appropriately somber.  no go.  stores closed because i had to be at my new, fantastic photo job by ten.
ten o'clock, i arrive at the davis'.  we were supposed to have a photo shoot today, but it was too chilly to be outside, so for the first time, i helped with office work.  actually, most of what i was doing was organizing her personal files and it was boring, but you know what?  not bad at all.  catherine is a very, very pleasant person (and she doesn't hate me for having purple hair.  i was a little concerned.)
while i was working, a woman called me and offered me another job!  my first payed singing work!  i'm so excited.  who cares that it's at a methodist church?  i dig jesus when necessary.  actually, i kind of have a thing for hymns.  
i worked there until one thirty, filing and chatting and enjoying the beautiful weather through the open door.  i made $28.  this new job is enough to pay for my voice lessons. :)
from there, i went to buy that skirt.  and guess what!  i did.  and it was a lot cheaper than i expected, so i bought a shirt too.  let me just say, this not wearing uniforms thing is difficult.  i feel like i wear the same clothes day in and day out.  which is really, really hilarious when you think about it.  ahem.
work was carazy!  we had tons of "MOPS" women in.  i had no idea what MOPS women were.  "hi!  i'm here for my MOPS workshop."  "hi, i'm a MOPS mom!"
...wtf?
Mothers of PreSchoolers.  of course?
so there were tons of kids and tons of moms in the store, but we sold lots and lots of beads.  and i learned how to make a new bracelet!  it's pretty neat.
i've had to start wearing heels to work, because apparently i wasn't dressing up enough before.  (i have to fucking dress up for my minimum wage job at a bead shop?)  so my feet were killing me and i didn't get out of there until about 6:50.  oh well. more money!
so i hopped in the car and headed on home.  unfortunately, i had to eat dinner by myself, but that was okay.  adam was fantastic phone company.  then off he went to read meno or something productive like that, so i decided to be productive too.
i'm finally almost done with those stupid online courses!
so i hang out and do my work and stuff, and then i decide i'm hungry.  ordinarily i would wait until around now to go eat, but i'm having minor surgery tomorrow, so i can't eat after midnight.  
i have a minor tiff with my mom.
i think she thinks she's two.
oh well.
toddlers will be toddlers.
and here we are, pretty much.
see?  i'm not terrible.  well, i might be a little terrible.  but not quite -as- terrible.

moron.
why am i nice to you?

sigh.
that's all i have to say about any of this.





i'm trying this not taking myself too seriously thing again.  
it's not really working out.

fuck everything.  i probably don't deserve to go there anyway.


it's nice how i'm only brave enough to put certain things in the journal that nobody fucking reads.
i forgot how hard this was.

oftentimes, things suck ass.
in fact, i might venture to say that most times, things suck ass.
tomorrow, though.
tomorrow should be good.

there's this gigantic chasm between me and the rest of the world.  sometimes there's a land bridge, but you know, continents shift, the sea level rises, whatever.


but it's just like everything else.

i want to claw my face off.

i feel like i'm suffocating in my skin.  it's not a feeling i've had for a while.

i don't know why i feel so threatened by everything.
adam, i'm sorry.

i am feeling vaguely abandoned.

it's interesting how i only feel the need to post on bad days.  i suppose not that interesting.  when i'm happy, i don't really need to look for validation (and that's really all this thing is about).  since my happiness -comes- from validation, though, every time i'm unhappy, here i am.  sitting in front of the computer screen.  my psychologist asks me "what do you do when you feel depressed?  watch tv?  read a book?"  i respond "i curl up in bed or write about it in an online journal."  "brilliant," he says.  "you're thinking bummer thoughts and instead of doing something proactive to take your mind off them, you dwell.  way to be constructive."  in some situations there is no place for sarcasm, dr. jones.  i already feel ridiculous enough the way it is.

rightfully so, i imagine.  for the three of you that read this thing, let it be known that i know what a self-indulgently absurd person i am.  i have to wonder that anyone takes me seriously.  or even -if- anyone takes me seriously.  maybe they don't.  maybe i've just self-indulge in that respect, too.

it's times like these that make me want to smash my head through a plate glass window.  it's like i don't deserve to live, but i don't deserve to wallow in whatever you want to call this enough to want to kill myself either.  i live in a limbo of pseudo discontent because i'm not smart enough or real enough or whatever it is that you have to be in order to have legitimate feelings.

sarahead is love
brought to you by the isLove Generator
i am confused by this.
for adam at my house tonight.  7:30.  be there.
i'm so excited!  adam's coming home tomorrow!

i'm always inclined to post the same things in my livejournal as on my xanga.  then i realize the people that read both will think i'm a dork.

i'm wearing so much clothing right now.  it's delicious.  except for my poor, cold little hands tapping away at the keyboard, proverbial little noses to the grindstone.  hands are good little helpers.  i think we should all take a moment. 

(it's three o'clock in the morning and i spent the evening with emily pounds.)
call me. email is annoying and you've apparently given up on AIM.
i am so ill-equipped to speak.
so i'm bonding with ethan's ex.  the situations that we were in with ethan are uncannily similar.  i'll refrain from outlining them in detail, but believe me.  they're freakish.

so i was right. i am just pathetic.

"of course you're going to be sad if you think sad thoughts, sarah."

oh, right. 
i'll just stop that.
i wish i weren't so lonely.  i wish i could learn to entertain myself.  the same episodes of "everybody loves raymond" are  just getting a little stale.
apparently i am easier to dismiss than either of us thought.
disconcertingly angry.  and i know that this fuck you attitude will get me nowhere, but i really have the urge to hurt someone right now.
this secret entry made me feel guilty.  i am trying to be a better person, i promise.
i need a good novel.  i've literally read every book on the upper two floors.  suggest away.

i'm going to start trying to be more exciting.  encourage me people!  nobody comments!  i was going to make some analogy about how livejournal is a stage and there's no point in writing if you don't have an audience, but then i decided i was too tired. oy.  that is so true.

also:
evolution.  thoughts?
also, i said i was done with this thing, but i lied.  i'm not.
i am made more and more aware that i have nothing intelligent to contribute.
